neighbors.name: Bianco 20 LLC
neighbors.claims: Bianco 20, LLC is an Arizona limited liability company incorporated in June 2024 ([BizProfile](https://www.bizprofile.net/az/scottsdale/bianco-20-llc)). The entity owns approximately 21.76 acres of undeveloped land on North Bianco Road in Casa Grande, Pinal County ([Phoenix West Valley Homes](https://phoenixwestvalleyhomesforsale.com/idx/0-N-Bianco-Road-Casa-Grande-AZ-85194-mls_6876448/)). The property is currently listed for sale (asking $895,000) as a heavy industrial site (zoned I-3), with the listing highlighting its proximity to the NRS Semiconductor and Kohler plants ([Phoenix West Valley Homes](https://phoenixwestvalleyhomesforsale.com/idx/0-N-Bianco-Road-Casa-Grande-AZ-85194-mls_6876448/)). The listing includes preliminary site plans and engineering, explicitly marketing the parcel for industrial development such as contractor yards or storage ([Phoenix West Valley Homes](https://phoenixwestvalleyhomesforsale.com/idx/0-N-Bianco-Road-Casa-Grande-AZ-85194-mls_6876448/)). The entity appears to be a single-asset investment vehicle positioned to sell to a developer.
neighbors.influence_justification: Passive land investment entity with no documented local political activity; influence is limited to its role as a seller of industrial-zoned land.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach the listing broker directly with an offer; the entity is actively marketing the land for industrial use, aligning perfectly with development goals.

citations.claim: Bianco 20, LLC is an Arizona limited liability company incorporated in June 2024
citations.title: Bianco 20 LLC Company Profile

citations.claim: The entity owns approximately 21.76 acres of undeveloped land on North Bianco Road in Casa Grande, Pinal County
citations.title: 0 N Bianco Road Listing Details

citations.claim: The property is currently listed for sale (asking $895,000) as a heavy industrial site (zoned I-3)
citations.title: 0 N Bianco Road Listing Details

neighbors.name: Sonoran Land Fund LLC
neighbors.claims: Sonoran Land Fund, LLC is an Arizona-based investment company incorporated in October 2012 ([BizProfile](https://www.bizprofile.net/az/phoenix/sonoran-land-fund-llc)). Its managing member is Compound Holdings LLC of Phoenix ([BizProfile](https://www.bizprofile.net/az/phoenix/sonoran-land-fund-llc)). The fund is associated with investor Wayne Howard, who has a history of purchasing large volumes of tax liens in Pinal County ([Tax Title Services](https://www.taxtitleservices.com/new-life-possible-for-smith-bill-creating-low-aggregate-fee-for-tax-liens/)). In 2015, the entity was at the center of a legislative controversy (SB 1071) regarding county fees for processing thousands of tax deeds, indicating a business model focused on distressed asset acquisition and cost minimization ([InMaricopa](https://inmaricopa.com/smith-tax-lien-bill/)). The fund holds a significant number of parcels in the area, consistent with a land banking or speculation strategy ([Pinal Central](https://bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com/pinalcentral.com/content/tncms/assets/v3/editorial/f/50/f500f59e-2001-11e9-922f-4b8e6ba8b2c1/5c49fd844cc29.pdf.pdf)). While the entity has engaged in legislative lobbying regarding property fees, there is no record of them taking a stance on renewable energy development specifically.
neighbors.influence_justification: Demonstrated ability to engage state legislators (sponsored bill SB 1071) and mobilize legal resources; however, influence appears transactional rather than community-based.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via Compound Holdings LLC; frame the project as a driver of land value appreciation which benefits their speculative holdings.

citations.claim: Sonoran Land Fund, LLC is an Arizona-based investment company incorporated in October 2012
citations.title: Sonoran Land Fund LLC Company Profile

citations.claim: Its managing member is Compound Holdings LLC of Phoenix
citations.title: Sonoran Land Fund LLC Company Profile

citations.claim: The fund is associated with investor Wayne Howard, who has a history of purchasing large volumes of tax liens in Pinal County
citations.title: New Life Possible for Smith Bill Creating Low Aggregate Fee for Tax Liens

citations.claim: In 2015, the entity was at the center of a legislative controversy (SB 1071) regarding county fees for processing thousands of tax deeds
citations.title: Smith tax lien bill fails in House

neighbors.name: Ethington & Hwy 84 LLC
neighbors.claims: Ethington & Hwy 84, LLC is an Arizona limited liability company linked to local land brokerage Willis Property Company ([Willis Land Co](https://www.willislandco.com/our-team.html)). The entity appears to be a joint venture involving Willis Holdings, L.C. (managed by C. Dale Willis Jr. and Ryan Willis) and Hamstra Investments, LLLP, a Chandler-based investment vehicle ([AZCC](https://ecorp.azcc.gov/BusinessSearch/BusinessInfo?entityNumber=23358315)). The Willis family specializes in land investment and brokerage in Pinal County, often positioning properties for commercial or industrial development ([Willis Land Co](https://www.willislandco.com/our-team.html)). Hamstra Investments is also a documented entity in Arizona corporate records ([AZCC](https://ecorp.azcc.gov/BusinessSearch/BusinessInfo?entityNumber=05287223)). The ownership structure and business activities suggest this entity is a land investment vehicle intended to market the property for development.
neighbors.influence_justification: Connected to established local land brokers (Willis Property Co) with deep knowledge of the Pinal County market and development landscape.

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact Ryan Willis or C. Dale Willis Jr. at Willis Property Company; the group is likely receptive to development proposals that monetize their holding.

citations.claim: Ethington & Hwy 84, LLC is an Arizona limited liability company linked to local land brokerage Willis Property Company
citations.title: Willis Property Company Team

citations.claim: Hamstra Investments, LLLP, a Chandler-based investment vehicle
citations.title: Hamstra Investments LLLP AZCC Record

neighbors.name: Pinal County
neighbors.claims: Pinal County holds title to parcels in the area, likely for public infrastructure or rights-of-way. The Pinal County Board of Supervisors is the primary approval authority for land use and zoning in the region. The Board has demonstrated a generally supportive but scrutinized stance on renewable energy: in December 2025, they approved the 2,137-acre Cactus Flower Solar project in a 3-2 vote, overturning a Planning Commission denial ([Pinal Post](https://pinalpost.com/2137-acre-cactus-flower-solar-and-battery-storage-approved/)). Similarly, in June 2024, the Board approved the SunDog Solar Energy Center in a 3-2 vote despite local opposition ([Rose Law Group](https://roselawgroupreporter.com/2024/06/pinal-board-approves-large-solar-farm/)). These split votes indicate that while the majority favors economic development and tax revenue from renewables, there is significant internal debate regarding land use compatibility and saturation.
neighbors.influence_justification: Regulatory authority with final vote on zoning and permits; controls public infrastructure and development standards.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage early with Planning staff and District Supervisors; address concerns raised in previous 3-2 votes (e.g., water use, visual impact) to secure the swing votes.

citations.claim: in December 2025, they approved the 2,137-acre Cactus Flower Solar project in a 3-2 vote, overturning a Planning Commission denial
citations.title: Cactus Flower Solar Project Approved by Pinal County Board of Supervisors

citations.claim: in June 2024, the Board approved the SunDog Solar Energy Center in a 3-2 vote despite local opposition
citations.title: Pinal board approves large solar farm

neighbors.name: Arizona Public Service Company (APS)
neighbors.claims: Arizona Public Service (APS) is the primary electric utility for the region and owns land in the vicinity for infrastructure purposes. APS is actively developing the "Bianco 230kV Transmission Line Siting Project" in the Casa Grande/Pinal County area, with siting completion estimated for Q1 2026 ([APS](https://www.aps.com/en/About/Construction-and-Power-Line-Siting/Power-Line-Siting/Power-Line-Siting-Projects/Bianco-230kV)). The project is designed to meet expanding energy needs and will include new transmission lines and a substation ([APS](https://www.aps.com/en/About/Construction-and-Power-Line-Siting/Power-Line-Siting/Power-Line-Siting-Projects/Bianco-230kV)). As a utility actively expanding its grid to accommodate growth, APS is a critical stakeholder for any new energy generation or industrial load in the area.
neighbors.influence_justification: Critical infrastructure provider; controls interconnection and grid capacity; actively developing transmission in the immediate vicinity.

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate immediately regarding the Bianco 230kV project timeline and interconnection feasibility; align project footprint with their planned corridors.

citations.claim: APS is actively developing the "Bianco 230kV Transmission Line Siting Project" in the Casa Grande/Pinal County area, with siting completion estimated for Q1 2026
citations.title: Bianco 230kV Transmission Line Siting Project

citations.claim: The project is designed to meet expanding energy needs and will include new transmission lines and a substation
citations.title: Bianco 230kV Transmission Line Siting Project
